intro: Melampyrum herbichii subsp. csatoi, commonly known as the Csato's touch-me-not, is a rare and specialized plant species native to specific regions of Central Europe. It belongs to the family Onagraceae, which includes other flowering plants known for their distinctive flowers and often showy blooms. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, tubular flowers that typically bloom in late summer. It thrives in moist, shaded habitats such as woodland floors and damp meadows. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
